result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany Pease was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant may do 50 hours of Community Service in lieu of FINE and DNA Surcharge, to be completed by 6/1/2016.  If the Community Service is not done by 6/1/2016, defendant to serve 5 days Huber with Standard Release conditions.  Court must receive notice of completion prior to due date.
07/15/2016 NOTICE RECEIVED THAT COMMUNITY SERVICE WAS COMPLETED. FINE AND COSTS WERE ADJUSTED TO ZERO.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiffany Pease

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received July 15, 2016,  Notice of Complete of 50 hours community service in lieu of fine and surcharge from WCS (reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 07-18-16, Check Case removed from calendar)

Defendant Tiffany Pease in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant working on completing the community service.  Defendant to file proof community service has been completed.  Court sets this case for a check case.  Check Case scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Appointing Atty Tom Voss;    Defendant to pay: $50 per month Signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez on May 4, 2016.  **no paper copy in physical file**
Review hearing on May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received May 4, 2016, dated May 3, 2016 from Atty Weathers regarding community service.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tiffany Pease in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #2:
FINE: $316.00 
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
50 hours of community service in lieu of FINE and DNA Surcharge to be completed by 6/1/2016.  If the community service is not done by 6/1/2016 defendant to 5 days in Huber with Standard Release Conditions.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-22-2016 09:30 am
dated Feb 1, 2016, requesting an earlier plea and sentencing date
Jury trial - 12 person at 04-05-2016 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 03-31-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Tiffany Pease in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers advises the pretrial offer was changed yesterday and they need additional time to contemplate the offer.  Court sets this case for trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-20-2016 09:30 am
Defendant Tiffany Pease in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 12-14-2015 09:00 am
from Judge Maxwell to Judge Ramirez
